24\n\n\nAgriculture and Rural Credit Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 7\n\n\nAgriculture and Marketing Act, R.S.N.S., c. 6\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The above measures allow the Province to regulate and issue various authorisations relating to the production and marketing of agricultural and food products and fish products within the Province, including measures related to the supply management of dairy, eggs and poultry products.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Nova Scotia or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business activities within Nova Scotia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-94\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nEnergy\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nElectricity\n\n\nServices incidental to energy distribution\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 17, 887\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCrown Lands Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 114\n\n\nElectricity Act, S.N.S. 2004, c. 25\n\n\nNova Scotia Power Privatization Act, S.N.S. 1992, c. 8\n\n\nNova Scotia Power Reorganization (1998) Act, S.N.S. 1998, c. 19\n\n\nPublic Utilities Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 380\n\n\nRenewable Electricity Regulations, O.I.C. 2010381 (October\u00a012,\u00a02010), N.S. Reg. 155/2010\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The above measures, among other things, permit the Government of Nova Scotia to:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0regulate and issue various authorisations relating to the production, development, operation and maintenance of generation, transmission (including system control), distribution, delivery, importation, exportation and supply of electricity, including electricity generated by renewable energy sources;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0provide for the granting of lands or waters within the Province for any good, source or force of energy from which it is possible to produce electricity, including the installation of wind turbines and hydroelectric developments; and\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Set and modify electricity rates, including feedin tariffs.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Nova Scotia or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business activities within Nova Scotia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Nunavut\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-95\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTourism, agriculture\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nOther \u2013 services incidental to hunting\n\n\nHunting, fishing and trapping industries\n\n\nTourist guide agencies (wilderness tourism)\n\n\nOwnaccount hunting\n\n\nLive animals\n\n\nHides, skins and furskins\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 021, 0297, 7472, 8813, 96419\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial  Nunavut\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nWildlife Act, S. Nu. 2003, c. 26, s. 113\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nIn the allocation of a dealer's licence, guiding licence, fur farm licence, game farm licence, tanning licence or taxidermy licence, preference shall be given to an applicant who had made his or her principal residence in the Nunavut Settlement Area for at least 18\u00a0continuous months prior to the submission of his or her application. Preference will also be given to applications that will likely provide direct benefits to the Nunavut economy, in particular through employment of local human and economic resources.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-96\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nLegal services (notaries public)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 861\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial  Nunavut\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nEvidence Act, R.S.N.W.T. 1988, c. E8, s. 79\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nEvery person who seeks appointment as a notary public must reside in Nunavut and be either a citizen of Canada or a person who has the status of a permanent resident of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Ontario\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-97\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAll sectors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness Corporations Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. B.16, ss. 118(3), 126(2), and 45(1)(b)\n\n\nSpecial Acts of the Legislature incorporating specific companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0At least 25 per cent of directors of corporations (other than nonresident corporation) must be resident Canadians. If fewer than four directors, at least one must be a resident Canadian. Majority of directors' meetings must be held in Canada each year.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Constraints may be placed on the transfer and ownership of shares in corporations. Corporations may sell shareholders' shares without their consent and purchase shares to qualify for certain benefits that are based on minimum Canadian ownership requirements.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-98\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nServices incidental to manufacturing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 884, 885\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTechnical Standards and Safety Act, 2000, S.O. 2000, c. 16\n\n\nUpholstered and Stuffed Articles, O. Reg. 218/01 ss. 8, and 17\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nExcept for a secondhand article, no person shall sell or offer for sale an upholstered or stuffed article that has not been manufactured by a manufacturer licenced in Ontario or manufactured in a designated jurisdiction.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-99\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nGambling and betting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 96492\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial  Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nGaming Control Act, 1992, S.O. 1992, c. 24\n\n\nGeneral O. Reg. 78/12\n\n\nOrder in Council 1413/08, ss. 3(b) and 16(i)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nOntario regulates gaming assistants and suppliers of services and equipment relating to lottery schemes, including games of chance, betting, bingos, casinos and promotional contests, including through provincial monopolies. Proceeds must be used to provide direct benefits to Ontario residents.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-100\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCollection agents\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 87902\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCollection and Debt Settlement Services Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. C14\n\n\nGeneral, R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 74, ss. 12(2)(a), and19.1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only Canadian citizens, permanent residents or persons ordinarily resident in Canada are eligible to be registered as collection agents and to engage in collection agency business in Ontario.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A corporation must be incorporated under Canadian legislation (federal or provincial) to carry on business of collection agencies in Ontario. Exemptions under the Act and regulation are provided for notforprofit credit counselling services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-101\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nReal estate services on a fee or contract basis\n\n\nReal estate services involving own or leased property\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 821, 822\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nReal Estate and Business Brokers Act, 2002, S.O. 2002, c. 30, Sched.\u00a0C\n\n\nGeneral, O. P\n\n\nContent of Wine, O. Reg. 659/00\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\nA winery in Ontario may sell wine manufactured from a blend of imported and domestic grape products with a minimum of 25\u00a0per\u00a0cent Ontario grape content per bottle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-103\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTourism\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nTravel agency, tour operator and tourist guide services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 7471\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTravel Industry Act, 2002, S.O. 2002, c. 30, Sched. D, s. 4(1)\n\n\nGeneral, O. Reg. 26/05, para.1 of s. 5, and ss. 10(1)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0An individual must be a Canadian resident to register as a travel agent and travel wholesaler in Ontario.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Registrants may carry on business only if their permanent place of business is in Ontario.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-104\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nProducts of agriculture\n\n\nServices incidental to agriculture\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 01, 8811 (other than rental of agricultural equipment with operator)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nWild Rice Harvesting Act, R.S.O., 1990, c. W. 7, ss. 1 and 3(2)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nA person seeking to harvest wild rice on Crown lands must obtain a licence. Only those who have resided in Ontario for 12 consecutive months immediately preceding the application are eligible for a licence.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-105\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nLand surveying (cadastral surveying)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 86753\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSurveyors Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. S.29, ss. 3(6), 5(1), 12(1), 14(2) and\u00a0(3)\n\n\nGeneral, O. Reg. 1026, s. 23\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only a resident of Canada may obtain a licence to conduct cadastral surveying. Only Canadian citizens can serve as councillors of the Association of Ontario Land Surveyors (\"AOLS\").\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A corporation must primarily offer professional survey services and 50 per cent of the board of directors must be members of the AOLS in order to obtain a Certificate of Authorization to offer cadastral surveying services. If the corporation offers cadastral surveying at least one director or full time employee must be licenced by the AOLS.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-106\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nServices incidental to hunting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 8813\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFish and Wildlife Conservation Act, S.O. 1997, c. 41, s. 1(1) Hunting, O.Reg. 665/98, s. 37\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nOnly a resident may be issued a licence for taking of bullfrogs for sale or barter. A resident is a permanent resident or has his or her primary residence in Ontario and has resided in Ontario for six months of the preceding 12 months.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-107\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nServices incidental to hunting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 8813\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFish and Wildlife Conservation Act, S.O. 1997, c. 41, s. 1(1)\n\n\nTrapping, O. Reg. 667/98, s. 11(1)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nOnly a Canadian citizen or an Ontario resident may be issued a licence to hunt or trap furbearing animals. An Ontario resident is defined as a person having his or her primary residence in Ontario and has resided in Ontario for six of the 12 months preceding application for a licence.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-108\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nSporting services\n\n\nServices incidental to hunting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 9641, 8813\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFish and Wildlife Conservation Act, S.O. 1997, c. 41\n\n\nHunting, O. Reg. 665/98, s. 12\nOntario Hunter Education Program Standards, Wildlife Policy Section, 2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nOnly Ontario residents are eligible to be appointed to instruct hunting education courses.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-109\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nServices incidental to hunting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 8813\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFish and Wildlife Conservation Act, S.O. 1997, c. 41, ss. 1(1), and\u00a032\n\n\nHunting, O. Reg. 665/98, ss. 94 and 95\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nTo be eligible for a licence to act as a guide for hunting in the Territorial District of Rainy River and for migratory bird hunting on Lake St. Clair, an applicant must be an Ontario or Canadian resident. A resident is a person having resided in Ontario for six consecutive months immediately preceding application for a licence.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-110\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nDistribution services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nWholesale trade services of fisheries products\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 62224\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFreshwater Fish Marketing Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. F.33\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nNo person is permitted to control the buying or selling of fish in Ontario except as authorised in the relevant Act.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-111\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nForestry\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nLogs of coniferous wood\n\n\nLogs of nonconiferous wood\n\n\nManufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture\n\n\nManufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials, on a fee or contract basis\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 0311, 0312, 8843\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial  Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCrown Forest Sustainability Act, S.O. 1994, c. 25, ss. 30 and 34 General, O. Reg. 167/95\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Forest resource licences that authorise the harvesting of Crown trees are subject to the condition that all trees harvested shall be manufactured in Canada into lumber, pulp, or other products.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Forest resource licences are issued in respect of specific areas of land. As such there are limits to the number of licences issued.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Minister may amend a forest resource licence in accordance with Regulation 167/95, which requires the submission of a forest management plan relating to social and economic objectives. The needs and benefits of the local communities will be given priorities into the planning effort and objective setting and achievement before broader nonlocal communities.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-112\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nVeterinary services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 932\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nVeterinarians Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. V. 3\n\n\nGeneral, O. B\n\n\nElectricity Act, S.O. 1998, c. 15, Sched. A\n\n\nGreen Energy Act, S.O. 2009, c. 12, Sched. A\n\n\nGreen Energy and Green Economy Act, 2009, S.O. 2009, c. 12\n\n\nMunicipal Franchises Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. M55\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Government of Ontario and its energy authorities, entities, and agencies, including, Independent Electricity System Operator, Ontario Power Generation Inc., Hydro One Inc. and the Ontario Energy Board, and their successors or assigns, may permit one or more persons or entities to establish or expand pipelines and electricity and gas infrastructure or to produce, transmit, distribute, conserve, manage (demand and load), store, sell, retail or market energy (including electricity, natural gas or renewable energy) in any region in Ontario including on corridor lands. Further, the Government of Ontario or one of its energy authorities, the Ontario Energy Board, or its successors or assigns, may regulate the rates, storage, standards or services provided by energy producers, distributors, transmitters, sellers, retailers, marketers and storage companies in Ontario.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, measures and actions taken by Ontario and energy authorities, entities, and agencies mentioned above and their successors or assigns, may involve discretionary decisions, based on factors that may afford preferential treatment in favour of:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0residents of Ontario; or\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business in Ontario.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For greater certainty, any enterprise formed in accordance with the laws of Ontario and having a place of business in Ontario, shall be treated in the same manner as an enterprise that is a resident of Ontario.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-116\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nMining\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nMetal ores, other minerals\n\n\nManufacture of basic metals on a fee or contract basis\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 14, 16, 8851\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nMining Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. Beer may only be sold in authorised government stores.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Registrar of Alcohol and Gaming authorises Ontario wine, spirits and beer manufacturers to operate stores for the sale of their own wine, spirits and beer, respectively. The Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario also authorises only The Beer Store for the sale of domestic and import beer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-121\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nAgricultural land, forest and other wooded land\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 5310\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nMunicipal Act, S.O 2001, c. 25, s. 308.1\n\n\nAssessment Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. Shore frontage includes, but is not restricted to, land adjacent to oceans, rivers, lakes, ponds, and swamps.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Government of Prince Edward Island issues permits to nonresident persons under the Act and may impose more onerous conditions including, that the land be identified under the land identification program for agricultural use or nondevelopment use.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only residents of Prince Edward Island are eligible for a property tax rebate on noncommercial real property.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation n.e.c.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 01, 02, 21, 22, 239, 6221, 62112\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial  Prince Edward Island\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nNatural Products Marketing Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, N3\n\n\nDairy Industry Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, D1\n\n\nAgricultural Products Standards Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, A9\n\n\nDairy Producers Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, D2\n\n\nAgricultural Insurance Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, A8.2\n\n\nAnimal Health and Protection Act, R.S.P.E.I., A11.1\n\n\nGrain Elevators Corporation Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1993, c. 8\n\n\nPlant Health Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1990, c. 45\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and CrossBorder Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The above measures allow Prince Edward Island to regulate and issue authorisations on a matter relating to marketing, including the buying, selling, packing grading, storing, processing, shipping for sale or storage, promoting, researching and offering for sale, in respect of, but not limited to: poultry, eggs, dairy, hogs, cattle, potatoes and turkeys, and including the production and transport to carry out the objects of these Acts.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Prince Edward Island or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-133\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFisheries and aquaculture\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nWholesale trade of fishery products\n\n\nServices incidental to fishing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 04, 62224, 882\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Prince Edward Island\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFisheries Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, F13.01\n\n\nFish Inspection Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, F13\n\n\nCertified Fisheries Organizations Support Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, C2.1\n\n\nNatural Products Marketing Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, N3\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The above measures allow Prince Edward Island to regulate and issue authorisations on a matter relating to resources and products of the fishery, including: maintenance and development of the resources of the fishery; fish buying and processing; and any other matter or thing in order to give full effect to the objects of these Acts.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Prince Edward Island or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-134\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nEnergy\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nElectricity, oil and natural E4\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The above measures allow Prince Edward Island to regulate and issue authorisations on a matter relating to energy and energy systems, oil and natural gas, and renewable energy sources including: the generation, accumulation, transmission, distribution, supply, purchase, utilisation and disposal of energy; the drilling of wells and the production and conservation of oil and natural gas; and generally for carrying out any of the purposes or provisions of these Acts.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Prince Edward Island or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-135\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture, forestry and fisheries harvesting, extraction and sale of forest products; issuing of licences, certification of forest producers; importation of plants or plant materials; fees and other charges; and generally for carrying out the provisions of the Acts.\n\n\n2.Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of\u00a0Prince Edward Island or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive\u00a0business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-136\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAlcoholic beverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCommission agents' services\n\n\nWholesale trade services\n\n\nRetailing services (liquor, wine and beer, liquor wine and beer stores)\n\n\nManufacture of alcoholic beverages.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 24 (other than 244), 62112, 62226, 63107\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Prince Edward Island\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLiquor Control Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, L14\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Prince Edward Island Liquor Control Commission (\"PEILCC\") is a Government of Prince Edward Island Crown agency that is the sole importer and controls the purchase, distribution and sale of alcoholic beverages in Prince Edward Island. The PEILCC operates warehouse, office facilities, and Licensee Distribution Centre. The commission supplies and administers the operations of retail liquor stores and\n\n Licensee Distribution Centre.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Prince Edward Island or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business and substantive business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-137\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nGambling and betting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Prince Edward Island Lotteries Commission is authorised under the Act to develop, organise, undertake, conduct and manage lottery schemes, parimutuel betting systems, and internet based gaming on behalf of the government of the Province or the governments of other provinces that have any agreement with this Province respecting any such lottery schemes or parimutuel betting systems.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, and having a place of business and substantive business operations within Prince Edward Island.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-138\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAll sectors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the acquisition of farm land by nonresidents, C.Q.L.R., c. A4.1\n\n\nRegulation respecting the declaration of nonresident status in the application for registration of the acquisition of farm land; C.Q.L.R., c. A4.1, r. 1\n\n\nRegulation respecting an application for authorization and the information and documents required for the application, C.Q.L.R., chapter A4.1, r. 2\n\n\nRegulation respecting the tariff of duties, fees, costs made under the Act respecting the acquisition of farm land by nonresidents, C.Q.L.R., c. A4.1, r. 3\n\n\nAn Act respecting the preservation of agricultural land and agricultural activities, C.Q.L.R., c. P41.1, and regulations\n\n\nAn Act respecting the lands in the domain of the State, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0T8.1\n\n\nRegulation respecting the sale, lease and granting of immovable rights on lands in the domain of the State, C.Q.L.R., c. T8.1, r. 7\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Direct or indirect acquisition of farm land by nonresidents of Qu\u00e9bec must be authorised by the Commission de protection du territoire agricole du Qu\u00e9bec. When it receives an application for authorisation by nonresidents of Qu\u00e9bec, the Commission takes into consideration the possible uses of the land for agricultural purposes and the economic consequences thereof.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No person may, in a designated agricultural region, use a lot for any purpose other than agriculture without the authorisation of the Commission, which takes into consideration specific socioeconomics factors when rendering a decision.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Qu\u00e9bec residents are given priority in the purchase or lease of land in the domain of the State.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-139\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture, forestry and fisheries\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nProducts of agriculture\n\n\nHorticulture and market gardening\n\n\nLive animals and animal products\n\n\nWood in the rough\n\n\nFish and other fishing products\n\n\nMeat, fish, fruits, vegetables, oils and fats\n\n\nDairy products\n\n\nGrain mill products\n\n\nStarches and starch products\n\n\nOther food products\n\n\nServices incidental to agriculture\n\n\nServices incidental to animal husbandry\n\n\nServices incidental to fishing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 01, 02, 031, 04, 21, 22, 23, 8811 (other than rental of agricultural equipment with operator), 8812, 882\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nProfessional Syndicates Act, C.Q.L.R., c. S40\n\n\nAn Act respecting the marketing of agricultural, food and fish products, C.Q.L.R., c. M35.1\n\n\nR\u00e8glement des producteurs d'\u0153ufs d'incubation sur le contingentement, C.Q.L.R., c. M35.1, r. 223\n\n\nR\u00e8glement sur les quotas des producteurs d'\u0153ufs de consommation du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c. M35.1, r. 239\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Joint plans for the production and marketing of agricultural products and producers marketing boards may be administered by professional syndicates. Only Canadian citizens may ask to form a professional syndicate and be members of its administrative council.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only Canadian citizens may have access to the reserve for new hatching egg producers, are eligible to certain programs and can benefit from eggs quotas transfers outside of the centralised system.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-140\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture, forestry and fisheries\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nFish products\n\n\nServices incidental to fishing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 04, 882\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial  Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nMarine Products Processing Act, C.Q.L.R., c. T11.01\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\nThe Minister may, by regulation, prescribe the minimum processing standards with which an operator must comply for the preparation or canning of a marine product. The standards may vary according to the marine product.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-141\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCultural goods and property\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 963\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCultural Heritage Act, C.Q.L.R., c. P9.002\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A heritage cultural property may include a heritage document, immovable, object or site. After obtaining the opinion of the Conseil du patrimoine culturel, the Minister of Culture and Communications may classify all or part of any heritage property the knowledge, protection, enhancement or transmission of which is in the public interest.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Authorisation from the Minister is required when a person, natural or legal, wishes to sell or give away a classified heritage document or object to a government or department or agency of a government, other than the Gouvernement du Qu\u00e9bec, a natural person who is not a Canadian citizen or permanent resident or to a legal person that does not have a principal place of business in Qu\u00e9bec. Classified heritage property in the domain of the State may not be sold, conveyed by emphyteusis or given away without the Minister's authorisation. In other cases of alienation, prior written notice is required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-142\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nCommunity, social and personal services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nFuneral, cremation and undertaking services \n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 9703\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec \n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting medical laboratories, organ and tissue conservation and the disposal of human bodies, C.Q.L.R., c. L0.2\n\n\nRegulation respecting the application of the Act respecting medical laboratories, organ and tissue conservation and the disposal of human bodies, C.Q.L.R., c. L0.2, r. 1\n\n\nAn Act respecting prearranged funeral services and sepultures, C.Q.L.R., c. A23.001\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A natural person seeking a permit to act as a funeral director, on his or her behalf or for a legal person, partnership or an association having its head office in Qu\u00e9bec, must have resided in Qu\u00e9bec for at least 12 months preceding the request.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A person seeking a permit to practise embalming, cremation or thanatopraxy is not subject to the requirement to reside in Qu\u00e9bec provided that he or she resides in Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-143\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTransport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nTaxi services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 71221\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial  Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting transportation services by taxi, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S6.01\n\n\nTaxi Transportation Regulation, C.Q.L.R., c. S6.01, r. 3, Highway Safety Code, C.Q.L.R., c. C24.2\n\n\nRegulation respecting road vehicle registration, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0C24.2, r.\u00a029\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For a taxi owner's permit to be issued, assigned or transferred from the Commission des transports du Qu\u00e9bec, a natural person must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident. To be issued a taxi driver's permit by the Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 de l'assurance automobile du Qu\u00e9bec, a natural person must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0There is a limit of 20 taxi owner's permits per person.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-144\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTransport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInterurban special transportation\n\n\nTransportation of other freight\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 71214, 71239\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nHighway Safety Code, C.Q.L.R., c. C24.2\n\n\nRegulation respecting road vehicle registration, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0C24.2, r. 29\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nUnder the International Registration Plan (\"IRP\"), carriers only pay registration fees once, to the base jurisdiction, which in turn ensures travel for duly licenced vehicles in other jurisdictions. This system of apportionable fees works on the basis of the distance travelled in each jurisdiction. An IRP registration certificate is recognised by Canadian provinces and United States of America's states. An apportioned registration will only be granted to a person having a place of business in Qu\u00e9bec and where at least one of its vehicles accrues kilometres.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-145\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTransport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBus transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 71211, 71212, 71213, 71214, 71222\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTransport Act, C.Q.L.R., c. T12\n\n\nBus Transportation Regulation, C.Q.L.R., c. T12, r.\u00a016\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nIn issuing bus transportation permits, the Commission des Transports du Qu\u00e9bec may apply criteria of public need in the territory to be served. It may also consider if the issuance of the permit requested by the applicant is not likely to entail the disappearance of any other bus transport service or appreciably affect the quality thereof.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-146\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTransport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nRoad transportation\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 71231, 71232, 71233, 71234\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Minist\u00e8re des Transports, C.Q.L.R., c. M28\n\n\nTransport Act, C.Q.L.R., c. T12\n\n\nRegulation respecting the brokerage of bulk trucking services, C.Q.L.R., c. T12, r. 4\n\n\nAn Act respecting owners, operators and drivers of heavy vehicles, C.Q.L.R., c. P30.3\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Minister of Transport determines the conditions that a heavyvehicle operator located outside of Qu\u00e9bec but in the territory of a party to the Agreement on Internal Trade must meet to register in the bulk trucking register. The total number of registration allowed is limited. A heavyvehicle operator located outside of Qu\u00e9bec has to maintain its principal establishment outside of Qu\u00e9bec and its registration cannot be transferred.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Participation in the performance of a road construction, repair or maintenance work contract awarded by the Minister of Transport, is limited to small bulk trucking enterprises that subscribe to the brokerage service of an association holding a brokerage permit, for a minimum of 50 per cent of the transportation required that has to be offered to the brokerage permit holder. Bulk trucking enterprises that are not registered into the register will only have access to the remaining 50\u00a0per\u00a0cent of the transportation needed if the brokerage permit holder accepts the offer to transport 50 per cent of the transportation required.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0To obtain a brokerage permit, a nonprofit legal person or a cooperative shall demonstrate that it represents at least 35\u00a0per\u00a0cent of the operators of heavyvehicles that are registered in the bulk trucking register and that have its principal establishment in the zone for which the permit is applied for. An operator shall subscribe for brokerage services in the brokerage zone where he or she has his or her principal establishment or in the zone determined by regulation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-147\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTransport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nMaritime transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 72211\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des Traversiers du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S14\n\n\nTransport Act, C.Q.L.R., c. T12\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Commission des Transports du Qu\u00e9bec\u00a0shall issue or transfer a permit for the transport of passengers by water to a person who applies therefor on the form used by the Commission, if it considers that the person establishes the real and urgent necessity for an additional service for each of the ships to be used, if applicable, where he or she offers passengers a ferry service competing with another ferry service.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No person may be a member of the board of directors unless he is domiciled in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-148\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nSporting and other recreational services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 964\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting safety in sports, C.Q.L.R., c. S3.1\n\n\nRegulation respecting combat sports, C.Q.L.R., c. S3.1, r. 11\n\n\nRegulation respecting combat sports licensing, C.Q.L.R., c. S3.1, r.\u00a07\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nWith respect to professional combat sport, a person who is not domiciled in Canada cannot obtain a yearly referee's or judge's permit but may obtain a permit valid for a specific sports event.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-149\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTravel agency, tour operator and tourist guide services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nTravel agencies\n\n\nTour operation services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 7471\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTravel Agents Act, C.Q.L.R., c. A10\n\n\nRegulation respecting travel agents, C.Q.L.R., c. A10, r. 1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nA natural person applying for a travel agent licence on his or her own account must establish and maintain a principal establishment in Qu\u00e9bec. The association, partnership or person on whose behalf the licence is applied for must establish and maintain a principal establishment in Qu\u00e9bec. A principal establishment is an establishment in which the operations of the licencee are principally performed.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-150\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAll sectors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCooperatives Act, C.Q.L.R., c. C67.2\n\n\nRegulation under the Cooperatives Act, C.Q.L.R., c. C67.2, r. 1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Cooperatives Act places constraints on the issue, transfer and ownership of shares. Membership of the cooperative is subject to the member actually using the services offered by the cooperative and to the cooperative's ability to provide him with them. The Cooperatives Act also stipulates that every member of the cooperative or representative of a legal person or partnership that is a member may be a director. The head office of a cooperative, a federation or a confederation must at all times be located in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A cooperative, a federation or a confederation must carry on with its members a proportion of its total business according to a percentage determined by government regulation. In the case of a solidarity cooperative, this proportion is calculated separately for the members who are users of the cooperative and for those who are workers of the cooperative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-151\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAgriculture, forestry and fisheries\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nForestry and logging products\n\n\nProducts of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials\n\n\nPulp, paper and paper products\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 031, 31, 32\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Minist\u00e8re des Ressources Naturelles et de la Faune, C.Q.L.R., c. M25.2\n\n\nSustainable Forest Development Act, C.Q.L.R., c. A18.1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0All timber harvested in the domain of the State, including biomass volumes, must be completely processed in Qu\u00e9bec. However, the Government may, on the conditions it determines, authorise the shipment outside Qu\u00e9bec of incompletely processed timber from the domain of the State if it appears to be contrary to the public interest to do otherwise.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Minister may take measures for the development of lands or forest resources in the domain of the State that are under his or her authority in order to encourage regional development or implement any other related policy.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-152\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nHorse racing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 02113, 96492\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting racing, C.Q.L.R., c. C72.1\n\n\nRules respecting the breeding of Qu\u00e9bec Standardbred race horses, C.Q.L.R., c. C72.1, r. 6\n\n\nRules respecting Certification, C.Q.L.R., c. C72.1, r. 1\n\n\nRules respecting betting houses, CQLR, c. C72.1, r. 8\n\n\nRules respecting Standardbred horse racing, C.Q.L.R., c. C72.1, r.\u00a03\n\n\nRegulation respecting betting horses, C.Q.L.R., c. C72.1, r.7\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only a Canadian citizen may apply for a licence to operate a race track, a licence to hold races or a licence to operate a betting house.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A person who applies for registration of a Standardbred stallion with the R\u00e9gie des alcools, des courses et des jeux\u00a0(\"RACJ\") must be a resident of Qu\u00e9bec for at least 183 days.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only a Qu\u00e9bec race horse, as defined in the Rules respecting the breeding of Qu\u00e9bec Standardbred race horses, can be entitled to a privilege or advantage.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-153\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecreational, cultural and sporting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nGambling and betting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 96492\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des loteries du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S13.1\n\n\nAn Act respecting the R\u00e9gie des alcools des courses et des jeux, C.Q.L.R. chapter R6.1\n\n\nAn Act respecting lotteries, publicity contests and amusement machines, C.Q.L.R., c. L6\n\n\nLottery Scheme Rules, C.Q.L.R., c. L6, r. 12\n\n\nRules respecting amusement machines, C.Q.L.R., c. L6, r. 2\n\n\nRules respecting publicity contests, C.Q.L.R., c. L6, r. 6\n\n\nRules respecting video lottery machines, C.Q.L.R., c. L6, r. 3\n\n\nBingo Rules, C.Q.L.R., c. L6, r. 5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A person who applies for a licence to operate a lottery scheme must be a Canadian citizen or, in the case of a company or corporation, have an office in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A person who wishes to obtain an amusement machine operator's licence or merchant licence must be a Canadian citizen and in the case of a corporation, must be headquartered or have its principal establishment in Canada and have an office in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With regard to video lottery machines operated somewhere other than in a government casino, R\u00e9gie des alcools, des courses et des jeux\u00a0(\"RACJ\") may take Canadian citizenship or residence into account when making rules to determine the conditions for obtaining prescribed licences as well as operating standards, restrictions, or prohibitions. The RACJ may determine the conditions of player participation, or standards, restrictions, or prohibitions related to promotion, advertising, or educational programs pertaining to video lottery machines, which may only apply, in full or in part, to certain categories of individuals.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With respect to bingo, projects for which a charitable or religious organization applies for an inhall, media, or recreational bingo licence must be carried out entirely in Qu\u00e9bec. Individuals or companies that apply for a bingo supplier's licence must have an establishment in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No person may be a member of the board of directors unless he is domiciled in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-154\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAlcoholic beverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCommission agents' services\n\n\nWholesale trade services\n\n\nRetailing services\n\n\nBeverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 24 (other than 244), 62112, 62226, 63107\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des alcools du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S13\n\n\nRegulation respecting cider and other applebased alcoholic beverages, C.Q.L.R., c. S13, r. 4\n\n\nRegulation respecting wine and other alcoholic beverages made or bottled by holders of a wine maker's permit, C.Q.L.R., c. S13, r. 7\n\n\nRegulation respecting alcoholic beverages made and bottled by holders of a distiller's permit, C.Q.L.R., c. P9.1\n\n\nRegulation respecting liquor permits, C.Q.L.R., c. P9.1, r. 5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des alcools du Qu\u00e9bec\u00a0operates as a monopoly responsible for the importation, distribution, supply, transport, sale, trade and marketing of alcoholic beverages.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No person may be a member of the board of directors unless he or she is domiciled in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-155\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAlcoholic beverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCommission agents' services\n\n\nWholesale trade services\n\n\nRetailing services\n\n\nBeverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 24 (other than 244), 62112, 62226, 63107\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des alcools du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S13\n\n\nRegulation respecting the terms of sale of alcoholic beverages by holders of a grocery permit, C.Q.L.R., c. S13, r. 6\n\n\nAn Act respecting offences relating to alcoholic beverages, C.Q.L.R., c. I8.1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only those who own an establishment in Qu\u00e9bec may obtain a beer distributor's, brewer's, distiller's, wine maker's, cider maker's, warehouse, smallscale production or smallscale beer producer's permit.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Holders of a distiller's permit may only sell the products they produce or bottle to Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 des alcools du Qu\u00e9bec\u00a0(\"SAQ\"), unless they ship such products outside Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Holders of a smallscale production permit may sell the alcoholic beverages they produce on their production premises.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-156\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nAlcoholic beverages\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nCommission agents' services\n\n\nWholesale trade services\n\n\nRetailing services\n\n\nBeverages\n\n\nHotel and restaurant services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 24 (other than 244), 62112, 62226, 63107, 641, 642, 643\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting liquor permits, C.Q.L.R., c. P9.1\n\n\nRegulation respecting liquor permits, C.Q.L.R., c. P9.1, r. 5\n\n\nRegulation respecting the terms of sale of alcoholic beverages by holders of a grocery permit, C.Q.L.R., c. S13, r. 6\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0To obtain a liquor permit under the Act respecting liquor permits, persons who are not Canadian citizens must have been residing in Qu\u00e9bec as a permanent resident of Canada, unless they apply for a reunion permit or \"Man and His World\" permit as authorised representatives of a government, country, Province, or State.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Companies or corporations not listed on a Canadian stock exchange may obtain a permit to sell alcohol only if all their partners or directors and shareholders who hold ten per cent or more of shares with full voting rights are Canadian citizens or have been residing in Qu\u00e9bec as a permanent resident of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For certain product categories, marketing is carried out by holders of a grocery licence issued by the R\u00e9gie des alcools, des courses et des jeux\u00a0(\"RACJ\"). Grocers must buy authorised alcoholic beverages from an authorised distributor.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Liquor permit applicants who are not Canadian citizens must prove that they have lived in Qu\u00e9bec for at least one year. If an applicant is a company or corporation not listed on a Canadian stock exchange, it must prove, for each of its partners or directors and shareholders who own 10 per cent or more of shares with full voting rights and are not Canadian citizens that they have lived in Qu\u00e9bec for at least one year.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The person entrusted to manage the establishment for a holder of a permit authorising the sale or service of alcoholic beverages for consumption on a premise must have a Canadian social insurance number.\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With regard to reunion permits to sell alcohol, when the proceeds of an event are to be used for the purposes of a nonprofit corporation other than the permit applicant, the nonprofit corporation must have an establishment in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-157\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nEnergy\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nElectricity\n\n\nServices incidental to energy distribution\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 171, 887\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act Respecting the R\u00e9gie de l'\u00e9nergie, C.Q.L.R., c. R6.01\n\n\nHydroQu\u00e9bec Act, C.Q.L.R., c. H5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Qu\u00e9bec (including through the R\u00e9gie de l'\u00e9nergie\u00a0and Hydro-Qu\u00e9bec) may fix, determine and modify rates, tariffs, prices and other conditions relating to the production, purchase, transportation, transmission, supply, distribution, and sale of electric power.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, these measures may involve discretionary decisions based on various factors, the imposition of performance requirements or discrimination in favour of residents of Qu\u00e9bec or entities established in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or territory thereof and having a place of business or substantive business operations within Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-158\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nEnergy\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nElectricity\n\n\nServices incidental to energy distribution\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 171, 887\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the exportation of electric power, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0E23\n\n\nAn Act Respecting the R\u00e9gie de l'\u00e9nergie, C.Q.L.R, c. R6.01\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0HydroQu\u00e9bec, municipal electric power systems, and private electric power systems are holders of exclusive electric power distribution rights.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The exportation of electric power from Qu\u00e9bec is prohibited. The Gouvernement du Qu\u00e9bec\u00a0may nevertheless authorise, by order, on the conditions and in the cases it determines, a contract for the exportation of electric power from Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Contracts relating to the exportation of electric power by HydroQu\u00e9bec, including wheeling under a transportation service agreement, must be submitted to the Government for authorisation in the cases determined by the Government and are subject to such conditions as the Government may then determine.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-159\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nReal estate services involving own or leased property\n\n\nReal estate services on a fee or contract basis\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 821, 822\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nReal Estate Brokerage Act, C.Q.L.R., c. C73.2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nThe Real Estate Brokerage Act imposes residency requirements to brokers and agencies. Therefore, a broker must have an establishment in Qu\u00e9bec. In the case of a broker who acts on behalf of an agency, the broker's establishment is the agency's establishment. An agency must have an establishment in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Saskatchewan\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-160\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nSale, maintenance and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nWholesale trade services\n\n\nRetail sales of motor vehicles including automobiles and other road vehicles\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 61111, 61112\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Motor Dealers Act, R.S.S. 1978, c. M22\n\n\nThe Motor Dealers Regulations, R.R.S. c. M22 Reg. 1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nNo licence as a motor vehicle dealer shall be granted unless the applicant for the licence maintains in the Province a place of business satisfactory to the registrar and from which he or she conducts his or her business, or a portion of his or her business, as a dealer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-161\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nServices incidental to fishing\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 882\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Fisheries Act (Saskatchewan), 1994, c. Licences may be restricted to residents of the region of a local fishery.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-162\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nLegal services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 861\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Legal Profession Act, 1990, S.S. 199091, c. L10.1\n\n\nRules of the Law Society of Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada are eligible for membership in the Law Society of Saskatchewan as a student of law or lawyer. Only members of the Law Society of Saskatchewan holding a subsisting certificate of practice can practice law in Saskatchewan.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A person who has engaged in the active practice of law in another jurisdiction of Canada may, upon meeting certain conditions, be admitted as a member without having met the normal requirements. Occasional appearance memberships are available only to persons who are Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada and who are qualified to practice law in another jurisdiction of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-163\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nLegal services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 861\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Notaries Public Act, R.S.S. 1978, c. C16\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only Canadian citizens residing within Saskatchewan can be appointed a notary public for Saskatchewan.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only Canadian citizens can be appointed as a commissioner for oaths in and for Saskatchewan.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-164\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nTourism\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nOther \u2013 services incidental to hunting\n\n\nServices incidental to fishing\n\n\nTourist guide agencies\n\n\nOwn-account hunting\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 7472, 8813, 8820, 96419\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Wildlife Act, 1998, S.S. c. N3.1 Reg. 3\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment and Cross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\nA person who wishes to hold an outfitter's licence must be a Saskatchewan resident and have a head office in Saskatchewan.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation I-PT-165\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nReal estate services involving own or leased property\n\n\nReal estate services on a fee or contract basis\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 8210, 822\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Real Estate Act, S.S. 1995, c.
