Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nRecycling\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nISIC rev 3.1 37\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access \n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSweden reserves the right to limit the number of suppliers of privately funded recycling services at the level of local government, by establishing or maintaining monopolies, or granting a concession or exclusive rights on a non-discriminatory basis to a service provider or service providers. The limitation on market access reflects the application of the EU reservation relating to public utilities. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Environmental Code (1998:808) \n\n\nSFS 1994:1205 F\u00f6rordning (1994:1205) om producentansvar f\u00f6r returpapper \n\n\nSFS 2000:208 F\u00f6rordning (2000:208) om producentansvar f\u00f6r gl\u00f6dlampor och vissa belysningsarmaturer \n\n\nSFS 2005:209 F\u00f6rordning (2005:209) om producentansvar f\u00f6r elektriska och elektroniska produkter \n\n\nSFS 1997:185 F\u00f6rordning (1997:185) om producentansvar f\u00f6r f\u00f6rpackningar \n\n\nSFS 1994:1236 F\u00f6rordning (1994:1236) om producentansvar f\u00f6r d\u00e4ck \n\n\nSFS 1993:1154 F\u00f6rordning (1993:1154) om producentansvar f\u00f6r glasf\u00f6rpackningar och f\u00f6rpackningar av wellpapp \n\n\nSFS 2007:185 F\u00f6rordning (2007:185) om producentansvar f\u00f6r bilar \n\n\nSFS 2007:193 F\u00f6rordning (2007:193) om producentansvar f\u00f6r vissa radioaktiva produkter och herrel\u00f6sa str\u00e5lk\u00e4llor \n\n\nSFS 2006:1273 F\u00f6rordning (2006:1273) om producentansvar f\u00f6r f\u00f6rpackningar \n\n\nSFS 2009:1031 F\u00f6rordning (2009:1031) om producentansvar f\u00f6r l\u00e4kemedel\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nWaste management \n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nManagement of waste from households and waste related to producer responsibilities \n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 9402 \n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\n\u00a0Market access \n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSweden reserves the right to limit the number of suppliers of privately funded waste management services at the level of local government, by establishing or maintaining monopolies, or granting a concession or exclusive rights on a non-discriminatory basis to a service provider or service providers. The limitation on market access reflects the application of the EU reservation relating to public utilities.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Environmental Code (1998:808) \n\n\nSFS 1994:1205 F\u00f6rordning (1994:1205) om producentansvar f\u00f6r returpapper \n\n\nSFS 2000:208 F\u00f6rordning (2000:208) om producentansvar f\u00f6r gl\u00f6dlampor och vissa belysningsarmaturer \n\n\nSFS 2005:209 F\u00f6rordning (2005:209) om producentansvar f\u00f6r elektriska och elektroniska produkter \n\n\nSFS 1997:185 F\u00f6rordning (1997:185) om producentansvar f\u00f6r f\u00f6rpackningar \n\n\nSFS 1994:1236 F\u00f6rordning (1994:1236) om producentansvar f\u00f6r d\u00e4ck \n\n\nSFS 1993:1154 F\u00f6rordning (1993:1154) om producentansvar f\u00f6r glasf\u00f6rpackningar och f\u00f6rpackningar av wellpapp \n\n\nSFS 2007:185 F\u00f6rordning (2007:185) om producentansvar f\u00f6r bilar \n\n\nSFS 2007:193 F\u00f6rordning (2007:193) om producentansvar f\u00f6r vissa radioaktiva produkter och herrel\u00f6sa str\u00e5lk\u00e4llor \n\n\nSFS 2006:1273 F\u00f6rordning (2006:1273) om producentansvar f\u00f6r f\u00f6rpackningar \n\n\nSFS 2009:1031 F\u00f6rordning (2009:1031) om producentansvar f\u00f6r l\u00e4kemedel\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nMaritime transport \n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nCabotage\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 7211, CPC 7212\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMost-favoured-nation treatment\n\n\nObligations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment, Cross-Border Trade in Services and International Maritime Transport Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures may be taken on a reciprocal basis allowing vessels from Canada under the flag of Canada to operate cabotage traffic in Sweden in\u00a0so\u00a0far as Canada and its provinces and territories allow vessels registered under the flag of Sweden to operate cabotage traffic in Canada. The specific aim of this reservation depends on the content of a possible mutually agreed future agreement between Canada and Sweden. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\nAuxiliary services to rail and land transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of rail and road transport equipment and parts thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 6112, CPC 6122, part of CPC 8867, part of CPC 8868\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIn Sweden, maintenance and repair services of rail and road transport equipment are subject to an economic needs test when an investor intends to establish its own terminal infrastructure facilities. Main criteria: space and capacity constraints.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\nPlanning and Building Act (2010:900)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nOther services not included elsewhere\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nFuneral, cremation and undertaking services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 9703\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSweden reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure with respect to funeral, cremation and undertaking services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in the United Kingdom\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nAuditing services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 86211, CPC 86212 other than accounting services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe United Kingdom reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure with respect to the cross-border supply of auditing services. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\nCompanies Act 2006\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nHealth services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nMedical services\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 93121, CPC 93122\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nEstablishment for doctors under the National Health Service is subject to medical manpower planning.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nHealth services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nAmbulance services\n\n\nResidential health facilities services other than hospital services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 93192, CPC 93193\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe United Kingdom reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure with respect to the supply of privately funded ambulance services and residential health facilities services other than hospital services. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nHealth services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nHealth-related professional services, including medical and dental services as well as services by psychologists; midwives services\n\n\nServices by nurses, physiotherapists and paramedical personnel\n\n\nRetail sales of pharmaceutical, medical and orthopaedic goods, and other services supplied by pharmacists\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 63211, part of CPC 85201, CPC 9312, part of CPC 93191\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nCross-Border Trade in Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe United Kingdom reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure requiring the establishment of suppliers and restricting the cross-border supply of health-related professional services by service suppliers not physically present in the territory of the UK, including medical and dental services as well as services by psychologists;\u00a0midwives services;\u00a0services by nurses, physiotherapists and paramedical personnel; the\u00a0retail sales of pharmaceuticals and of medical and orthopaedic goods, and other services supplied by pharmacists.\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nSocial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIndustry Classification:\n\n\n\n\nCPC 933\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nPerformance requirements\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe United Kingdom reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure with respect to the supply of privately funded social services other than services relating to Convalescent and Rest Houses and Old People's Homes. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nExisting Measures:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n________________\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nWith regard to Austria the part of the most-favoured-nation treatment exemption regarding traffic rights covers all countries with whom bilateral agreements on road transport or other arrangements relating to road transport exist or may be considered in future.\n\n\n\n(2)\nApplies to East European companies, which are cooperating with one or more Nordic companies.\n\n\n\n(3)\nApplies to East European companies, which are cooperating with one or more Nordic companies.\n\n\n\n(4)\nApplies to East European companies, which are cooperating with one or more Nordic companies.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nStrasbourg, 5.7.2016\nCOM(2016) 444 final\nANNEX\n\nto the \nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing on behalf of the European Union of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement between Canada of the one part, and the European Union and its Member States, of the other part\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX III\n\n\n\n\nSchedule of Canada\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Schedule of Canada to this Annex sets out:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0headnotes that limit or clarify the commitments of Canada with respect to the obligations described in subparagraphs (b) and (c);\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in Section A, the reservations taken by Canada, pursuant to Articles 13.10.1 and 13.10.2 (Reservations and exceptions), with respect to an existing measure that does not conform with obligations imposed by:\n\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article 13.3 (National treatment);\n\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article 13.4 (Mostfavourednation treatment);\n\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article 13.6 (Market access);\n\n\n\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article 13.7 (Cross-border supply of financial services); or\n\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article 13.8 (Senior management and boards of directors);\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in Section B, the reservations taken by Canada, pursuant to Article 13.10.3 (Reservations and exceptions), for measures Canada may adopt or maintain that do not conform with obligations imposed by Articles 13.3 (National treatment), 13.4 (Most-favourednation treatment), 13.6 (Market access), 13.7 (Crossborder supply of financial services), or 13.8 (Senior management and boards of directors).\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Each reservation in Section A sets out the following elements:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sector refers to the general sector in which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sub-Sector refers to the specific sector in which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type\u00a0of\u00a0Reservation specifies the obligation referred to in subparagraph 1(b) for which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Level\u00a0of\u00a0Government indicates the level of government maintaining the measure for which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Measures identifies the laws, regulations or other measures, as qualified, where indicated, by the Description element, for which the reservation is taken. A\u00a0measure cited in the Measures element:\n\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0means the measure as amended, continued or renewed as of the date of entry into force of this Agreement; and\n\n\n\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0includes a subordinate measure adopted or maintained under the authority of and consistent with the measure; and\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Description sets out references, if any, for liberalisation on the date of entry into force of this Agreement pursuant to other sections of Canada's Schedule to this Annex, and the remaining nonconforming aspects of the existing measures for which the reservation is taken.\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Each reservation in Section B sets out the following elements:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sector refers to the general sector in which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sub-Sector refers to the specific sector in which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of Reservation specifies the obligation referred to in subparagraph 1(c) for which the reservation is taken;\n\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Level of Government indicates the level of government maintaining the measure for which the reservation is taken; and\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Description sets out the scope of the sectors, subsectors, or activities covered by the reservation.\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the interpretation of a reservation in Section A, all elements of the reservation shall be considered. A reservation shall be interpreted in the light of the relevant provisions of the Chapter against which the reservation is taken. To the extent that:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the Measures element is qualified by a specific reference in the Description element, the Measures element as so qualified shall prevail over all other elements; and\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the Measures element is not so qualified, the Measures element shall prevail over all other elements, unless any discrepancy between the Measures element and the other elements considered in their totality is so substantial and material that it would be unreasonable to conclude that the Measures element should prevail, in which case the other elements shall prevail to the extent of that discrepancy.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the interpretation of a reservation in Section B, all elements of the reservation shall be considered. The Description element shall prevail over all other elements.\n\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where Canada maintains a measure that requires that a service supplier be a citizen, permanent resident, or resident of its territory as a condition to the supply of a service in its territory, a reservation for that measure taken with respect to Articles 13.3 (National treatment), 13.4 (Mostfavoured nation treatment), 13.6 (Market access), 13.7\u00a0(Crossborder supply of financial services), and 13.8 (Senior management and boards of directors), shall operate as a reservation with respect to Articles 8.4 (Market access), 8.5 (Performance requirements), 8.6 (National treatment), 8.7 (Mostfavoured-nation treatment), and 8.8 (Senior management and boards of directors) to the extent of that measure.\n\n\n\n7.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A reservation for a measure that requires a service supplier be a natural person, citizen, permanent resident, or resident of its territory as a condition to the supply of a financial service in its territory taken with respect to Article 13.7 (Crossborder supply of financial services) shall operate as a reservation with respect to Articles 13.3 (National treatment), 13.4\u00a0(Mostfavourednation treatment), 13.6 (Market access), and 13.8 (Senior management and boards of \u200edirectors), to the extent of that measure.\n\n\nHeadnotes\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Commitments under this Agreement, in the subsectors listed in this Schedule, are undertaken subject to the limitations and conditions set forth in these headnotes and in the Schedule below.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The listing of a measure as a reservation in Section\u00a0A or B does not mean that it cannot otherwise be justified as a measure adopted or maintained for prudential reasons pursuant to Article 13.16 (Prudential carve out).\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0To clarify Canada's commitment with respect to Article\u00a013.6 (Market access), juridical persons supplying financial services and constituted under the laws of Canada are subject to nondiscriminatory limitations on juridical form\n1\n.\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a013.10.1(c) (Reservations and exceptions) shall not apply to nonconforming measures relating to Article\u00a013.6.1(b) (Market access).\n\n\nSchedule of Canada\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSECTION A\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Canada\n\n\n\n(applicable in all Provinces and Territories)\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-C-1\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nAll\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nNational\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBank Act, S.C. 1991, c.46, ss. 159, 749 \n\n\nInsurance Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c. 47, ss. 167, 796 \n\n\nTrust and Loan Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c. 45, s. 163\n\n\nForeign Institutions Subject to the Canadian Residency Requirements Regulations (Insurance Companies), S.O.R./2003185\n\n\nForeign Institutions Subject to the Canadian Residency Requirements Regulations (Trust and Loan Companies), S.O.R./2003186\n\n\nCooperative Credit Associations Act, S.C. 1991, c. 48, s. 169\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA minimum of one half of the directors of a federallyregulated financial institution that is a subsidiary of a foreign institution, and a majority of the directors of any other federallyregulated financial institution must be Canadian citizens ordinarily resident in Canada or permanent residents ordinarily resident in Canada.\n2\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-C-2\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nNational\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBank Act, S.C. 1991, c.46, s. 524\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIn order to establish a bank branch, a foreign bank must be a bank in the jurisdiction under whose laws it is incorporated.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-C-3\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nNational\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBank Act, S.C. 1991, c.46, s. 540\n\n\nSales or Trades (Authorized Foreign Banks) Regulations, S.O.R./200052\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA lending bank branch in respect of its business in Canada may only accept a deposit or otherwise borrow money by means of a financial instrument from, or guarantee a security or accept a bill of exchange issued by a person that is sold to or traded with:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a financial institution (other than a foreign bank); or\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a foreign bank that:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0is a bank according to the laws of the jurisdiction under whose laws it was incorporated or in any jurisdiction in which it carries on business;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0provides financial services and has a name that includes the word \"bank\", \"banque\", \"banking\" or \"bancaire\"; and\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0is regulated as a bank or as a deposittaking institution according to the jurisdiction under whose laws it was incorporated or in any jurisdiction in which it carries on business,\n\n\nif the financial instrument, security or bill of exchange cannot be subsequently sold or traded.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-C-4\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nAll\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nNational\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTrust and Loan Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c.45\n\n\nBank Act, S.C. 1991, c.46\n\n\nCooperative Credit Associations Act, S.C. 1991, c.48\n\n\nInsurance Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c. 47\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFederal laws do not permit a trust and loan company, credit union, or fraternal benefit society in Canada to be established through branches of corporations organised under a foreign country's law.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-C-5\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nAll\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nNational\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBank Act, S.C. 1991, c. 45, ss. 510, 522.16, 524\n\n\nInsurance Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c. 47, ss. 574, 581\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A bank branch must be established directly under the authorised foreign bank incorporated in the jurisdiction where the authorised foreign bank principally carries on business.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A foreign entity authorised to insure, in Canada, risks must be established directly under the foreign insurance company incorporated in the jurisdiction where the foreign insurance company, directly or through a subsidiary, principally carries on business.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Alberta\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-1\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access \n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. I13\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in Alberta can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Alberta laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0fraternal societies; or\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0special brokers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-2\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational Treatment\n\n\nMarket access \n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. I13\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSubsidiaries of foreign insurance corporations must be federallyauthorised.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-3\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance\n\n\nIntermediation of insurance contracts related to maritime transport and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), and to reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. I3\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A fee payable to the province of 50 per cent of the premium paid, and regulatory notification, are required on insurance of risks in the province by an unlicensed insurer, unless such insurance is placed by a special broker licensed in Alberta.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For greater certainty, a special broker licensed in Alberta is not required to be resident in Alberta and a licensed insurer is not required to have a commercial presence in Alberta.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-4\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access \n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Corporations Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. L-20\n\n\nLoan and Trust Corporations Regulation, Alta. Reg. 171/1992\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the Alberta regime an entity must be a body corporate to which the Loan and Trust Corporations Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-5\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational Treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Corporations Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. L20\n\n\nLoan and Trust Corporations Regulation, Alta. Reg. 171/1992\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAt least three quarters of the directors of a trust and loan company in Alberta must be ordinarily resident in Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-6\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket Access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Union Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. C32\n\n\nCredit Union Regulation, Alta. Reg. 249/1989\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA credit union must be incorporated in Alberta.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-7\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Union Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. C32\n\n\nCredit Union Regulation, Alta. Reg. 249/1989\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDirectors of credit unions in Alberta must be Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada and threequarters must at all times be ordinarily resident in Alberta.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-8\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nAdvisory and auxiliary financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. S4\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhere an advisor provides advice in Alberta such services must be supplied through a commercial presence in Alberta.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-9\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. S4, s.75\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers that are not resident or registered in Alberta.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-10\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Alberta\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. S4\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in British Columbia\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-11\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFor provinciallyincorporated trust companies, insurance companies and credit unions, the majority of directors must be ordinarily resident in Canada and at least one director must be ordinarily resident in British Columbia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-12\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, ss.7576\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in British Columbia can be provided only through: \n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under British Columbia laws; \n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds; or\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-13\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance, reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, ss. 48 through 51 with respect to trust, insurance, and holding companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhere any person controls or will control 10 per cent or more of the votes of a company, incorporation, share acquisition or application for business authorisation is subject to approval by the financial institutions commission.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-14\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nReinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial Services Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nServices must be supplied through a commercial presence in British Columbia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-15\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nAll payment and money transmission services \u2013 trust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, ss. 48 through 51\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhere any person controls or will control 10 per cent or more of the votes of a company, incorporation, share acquisition or application for business authorisation is subject to approval by the financial institutions commission.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-16\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance) \n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are neither resident nor registered in British Columbia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-17\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 British Columbia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418\n\n\nNational Instrument 81102 Investment Funds, B.C. Reg. 20/2000, Part\u00a06\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if the subcustodian has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Manitoba\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-18\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Insurance Act, C.C.S.M. c. 140\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in Manitoba can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Manitoba laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0fraternal societies; or\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0special brokers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-19\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Corporations Act, C.C.S.M. c. C225\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the Manitoba regime an entity must be a body corporate to which PART XXIV of The Corporations Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-20\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Corporations Act, C.C.S.M. c. C225\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe direct or indirect acquisition of Canadiancontrolled companies by nonresidents is restricted to 10 per cent individually and 25 per cent collectively.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-21\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Corporations Act, C.C.S.M. c. C225, s. 346(1) and (2)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA nonresident shareholder may not vote, or cause to be voted, his or her or its shares, unless the nonresident is the registered shareholder of the shares.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-22\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance) \n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Corporations Act, C.C.S.M. c. C225, s. 321(6)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA majority of directors of provincially incorporated trust and loan companies must be residents of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-23\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Credit Unions and Caisses Populaires Act, C.C.S.M. c. C301\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A credit union or caisse populaire must be incorporated in Manitoba.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The purpose of a credit union is to provide financial services on a cooperative basis to its members, and for such services to be directed or controlled primarily by residents of Manitoba. The purpose of a caisse populaire is to provide financial services in the French language on a cooperative basis to its members, and for such services to be directed or controlled by Frenchspeaking individuals who are resident in Manitoba. \n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"Resident in Manitoba\" is defined as an individual legally entitled to be in Canada, has made his or her home in Manitoba, and is physically present in Manitoba for at least six months in a year. A reference in the English version of the The Credit Unions and Caisses Populaires Act to a credit union includes a caisse populaire, and a reference in the French version of the Act to a caisse populaire includes a credit union.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-24\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Credit Unions and Caisses Populaires Act, C.C.S.M. c. C301\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA director of a credit union or caisse populaire must be a resident of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-25\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCommunity bonds corporations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment \n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Agricultural Societies Act, C.C.S.M. c. A30\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA director of a community bonds corporation must be a resident of Manitoba.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-26\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Securities Act, C.C.S.M. c. S50\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are not resident or registered in Manitoba.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-27\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures and advisory and auxiliary financial services \u2013 dealers, brokers, advisers\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Securities Act, C.C.S.M. c. S50\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the applicant is a corporation, at least one officer or director must meet the \"usual residence qualification\", and where the applicant is a partnership, at least one partner or member who is an individual must meet the \"usual residence qualification\".\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The \"usual residence qualification\" requires the applicant to be resident in Manitoba at the date of the application and to have been resident in Canada for at least one year immediately before the date of the application, or to have been registered under the securities laws of another Canadian jurisdiction in which the applicant last resided and to have been so registered for at least one year immediately before the date of the application.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-28\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance) Trading for own account and for account of customers: custodial services; trading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons; securities dealers and brokers; trading in securities and commodity futures; advisory and auxiliary financial services; dealers, brokers, advisors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Securities Act, C.C.S.M. c. S50\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual applicant for registration must be a resident of Canada for a period of at least one year prior to the application and a resident of the province in which he or she wishes to operate at the date of application.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-29\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Manitoba\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Securities Act, C.C.S.M. c. S50\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in New Brunswick\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-30\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.N.B. 1973, c. I12\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in New Brunswick can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under New Brunswick laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds; or\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-31\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Companies Act, S.N.B. 1987, c. L11.2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the New Brunswick regime an entity must be a body corporate to which the Loan and Trust Companies Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-32\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Companies Act, S.N.B. 1987, c. L11.2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAt least two of the directors of a trust and loan company must be resident in New Brunswick.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-33\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Companies Act, S.N.B. 1987, c. L11.2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIncorporation or registration of a trust and loan company in New Brunswick will be refused unless authorities are satisfied that there exists a public benefit and advantage for an additional corporation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-34\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, S.N.B. 2004, c. S5.5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThere is a requirement for an individual or firm to register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are not resident or registered in New Brunswick.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-35\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Unions Act, S.N.B.1994, c. S5.5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA director of a Community Bonds corporation must be a resident of New Brunswick.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-37\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment \n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 New Brunswick\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, S.N.B. 2004, c. S5.5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. I10\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe purchase of reinsurance services by an insurer, other than a life insurer or a reinsurer, from a nonresident reinsurer, is limited to no more than 25 per cent of the risks undertaken by the insurer purchasing the reinsurance.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-40\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Newfoundland and Labrador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCorporations Act, R.S.N.L. 1990, C36\n\n\nTrust and Loan Corporations Act, S.N.L. 2007, c. T9.1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the Newfoundland and Labrador regime an entity must be a body corporate to which the Trust and Loan Corporations Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-41\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Newfoundland and Labrador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Union Act 2009, S.N.L. 2009, c. C37.2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA credit union must incorporate in Newfoundland and Labrador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-42\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Newfoundland and Labrador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.L. 1990, c. S13\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIn certain restricted circumstances, the Superintendent of Securities may refuse registration:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0to an individual, or\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0to a person or company,\n\n\nif the individual, or any director or officer of the person or company, has not been a resident of Canada for at least one year immediately prior to the date of application for registration.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-43\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Newfoundland and Labrador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.L. 1990, c. S13\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are not resident or registered in Newfoundland and Labrador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-44\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Newfoundland and Labrador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.L. 1990, c. S13\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in the Northwest Territories\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-45\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Northwest Territories\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.N.W.T. 1988, c. I4\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services can be provided in the Northwest Territories only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Northwest Territory laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges; or\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0fraternal societies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-46\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Northwest Territories\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nBusiness Corporations Act, S.N.W.T. (Nu) 1996, c. 19\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFederal or provincial incorporation of a trust and loan company is required in the Northwest Territories.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-47\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Northwest Territories\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Union Act, R.S.N.W.T. (Nu) 1988, c. C23\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA credit union must incorporate in the Northwest Territories.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-48\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Northwest Territories\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.W.T. (Nu) 1988, c. S5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are not resident or registered in the Northwest Territories.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-49\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Northwest Territories\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, S.N.W.T. 2008, c. 10\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Nova Scotia\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-50\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector: \n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 231\n\n\nLicensing of Insurers Regulations, N.S. Reg. 142/90 or any other subsidiary measures made thereto\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in Nova Scotia can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Nova Scotia laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0fraternal societies;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0special brokers;\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0sororal societies; or\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0mutual benefits societies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-51\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nIntermediation of insurance contracts related to maritime transport and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), and to reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 231\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nServices must be supplied through a commercial presence in Nova Scotia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-52\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTrust and Loan Companies Act, S.N.S. 1991, c. 7 and any subsidiary measures made thereto\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIncorporation or registration of a trust and loan company in Nova Scotia will be refused unless authorities are satisfied that there exists a public benefit and advantage for an additional corporation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-53\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTrust and Loan Companies Act, S.N.S. 1991, c. 7 and any subsidiary measures made thereto\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAt least two of the directors of a provincial company must be ordinarily resident in Nova Scotia and a majority of the directors must be ordinarily resident in Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-54\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTrust and Loan Companies Act, S.N.S. 1991, c. 7\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the Nova Scotia regime an entity must be a body corporate to which the Trust and Loan Companies Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-55\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services Nova Scotia must be a Canadian citizen.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-56\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other Scotia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-58\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nResidential mortgages services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of R.S.N.S. 1989, c.\u00a0291 and any subsidiary measure made thereto\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA mortgage broker must be a resident of Nova Scotia.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-59\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Nova Scotia\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.S. 1989, c. 418\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIn certain restricted circumstances, the Superintendent of Securities may refuse registration in Nova Scotia:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0to an individual, or\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0to a person or company,\n\n\nif the individual, or any director or officer of the person or company, has not been a resident of Canada for at least one year immediately prior to the date of application for registration.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation (Nu) 1998, c.10\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are not resident or registered in Nunavut.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-67\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nTerritorial \u2013 Nunavut\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, R.S.N.W.T. (Nu.) 1988, c. S5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Ontario\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-68\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. I.8, s. 42\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in Ontario can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Ontario laws;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction; or\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0reciprocal insurance exchanges; or\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0fraternal societies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-69\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services \u2013 services auxiliary to insurance and pension funding\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMostfavourednation treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. I.8, ss. 48 (3), 48 (7), 169(2) \n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual insurance companies are subject to less onerous capital requirements if they are a member of the Fire Mutuals Guarantee Fund. Any mutual insurance company can be a member of the Fire Mutuals Guarantee Fund but membership is subject to the approval of the Superintendent of Financial Services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-70\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nReinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. I.8, s. 54\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nServices must be supplied through a commercial presence in Ontario.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-71\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nLoan and Trust Corporations Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. L.25, s. 31\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nOnly a corporation incorporated under the federal Trust and Loan Companies Act, S.C. 1991, c.\u00a045 may apply for initial registration to carry on business as a loan corporation or as a trust corporation in Ontario.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-72\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of 11, s. 332\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA credit union must incorporate in Ontario.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-73\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nFinancial intermediation services, other than insurance and pension fund services\n\n\nCredit unions and caisses populaires\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nSenior management and board of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Unions and Caisses Populaires Act, 1994, S.O. 1994, c. 11, ss. 23, 91, 160, 332\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nOnly a natural person who is a member of the credit union, at least 18 years of age, and a Canadian citizen or a person admitted to Canada for permanent residency who is ordinarily resident in Canada, is eligible to be a director of a credit union.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-74\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services c.\u00a029\n\n\nMortgage Brokers and Agents: Licensing, O. Reg. 409/07\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA mortgage broker or mortgage agent (both are occupations practised by a natural person) must be a resident of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-75\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nServices auxiliary to financial intermediation other than insurance and pension funding\n\n\nMortgage brokers\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nMortgage Brokerages, Lenders and Administrators Act, 2006, S.O. 2006, c.\u00a029;\n\n\nMortgage Brokerages: Licensing, O. Reg. 408/07\n\n\nMortgage Administrators: Licensing, O. Reg. 411/07\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA mortgage brokerage or a mortgage administrator (business entities) must be a corporation incorporated in a Canadian jurisdiction, a partnership formed under the laws of a Canadian jurisdiction, or a sole proprietor who is a resident of Canada.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-76\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrading in securities and commodity futures \u2013 persons\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Ontario\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCommodity Futures Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. E14, s.\u00a04\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTo operate as a trust and loan company under the Prince Edward Island regime an entity must be a body corporate to which the Trust and Fiduciary Companies Act applies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-81\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCredit unions, caisses populaires and associations or groups thereof\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Prince Edward Island\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nCredit Unions Act, R.S.P.E.I. 1988, c. IIIA-PT-84\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\n\nAn Act to amend the Act respecting \"Qu\u00e9bec Health Services\" \"Les Services de Sant\u00e9 du Qu\u00e9bec\" and respecting SSQ, Mutuelle de gestion and SSQ, Life Insurance Company Inc., S.Q. 1993, c. 107\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nUpon any allotment or transfer of voting shares of the capital stock insurance company \"SSQ, Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 d'assurance vie inc\" or of the holding company \"Groupe SSQ inc\", the minister may, if the transfer confers control of the company to nonresidents, ask such companies to prove that the shares were offered in priority to Qu\u00e9bec residents and subsidiarily to other Canadian residents, but that no offer was made or was acceptable.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-85\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding Caisse de d\u00e9p\u00f4t et placement du Qu\u00e9bec, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0C2\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA minimum of threequarters of the members of the board of directors must reside in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-86\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\nSenior management and boards of directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting insurance, C.Q.L.R., c. A32\n\n\nAn Act respecting trust companies and savings companies, C.Q.L.R., c.\u00a0S29.01\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Threequarters of the directors of trust companies and savings companies must be Canadian citizens.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A majority of the directors of insurance companies, mutual insurance companies, saving companies and trust companies, shall reside in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The direct or indirect acquisition of Canadiancontrolled savings companies or trust companies by nonresidents is restricted to 10 per cent individually and 25 per cent collectively.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-87\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting insurance, C.Q.L.R., c. A32\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Every legal person not constituted under an Act of Qu\u00e9bec which does not have its head office in Qu\u00e9bec shall, when applying for a licence, appoint a chief representative in Qu\u00e9bec. The representative must be a person in authority who is resident in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Every legal person not constituted under an Act of Qu\u00e9bec has, in respect of the activities it carries on in Qu\u00e9bec, the rights and obligations of an insurance company or mutual association constituted under Acts of Qu\u00e9bec as the case may be. It is also bound to comply with its constituting Act if it is more restrictive.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-88\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting insurance, C.Q.L.R., c. A32\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nInsurance services in Qu\u00e9bec can be provided only through:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a corporation incorporated under Qu\u00e9bec statutes;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an extraprovincial insurance corporation, that is, an insurer incorporated by, or under the laws of another Canadian jurisdiction;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a federallyauthorised branch of a foreign corporation; or\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an association formed on the plan known as Lloyds.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-89\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nIntermediation of insurance contracts related to maritime transport and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), and to reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nAn Act respecting the distribution of financial products and services, C.Q.L.R., c. V1.1\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAn individual or firm must register in order to trade through dealers and brokers that are neither resident nor registered in Qu\u00e9bec.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-94\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nCustodial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nNational treatment\n\n\nCrossborder supply of financial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Qu\u00e9bec\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nSecurities Act, C.Q.L.R., c. V1.1, r. 39\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMutual funds which offer securities in Canada must use a resident custodian. A nonresident subcustodian may be used if it has shareholders' equity of at least CAD$ 100 million.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservations applicable in Saskatchewan\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-95\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nInsurance and insurance related services\n\n\nDirect insurance and reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nThe Saskatchewan Insurance Act, R.S.S. 1978, c. S26\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDescription:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA fee payable to the province of 10 per cent of the premium is required on insurance of risks in the province by unlicensed insurers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReservation IIIA-PT-97\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector:\n\n\n\n\nFinancial services\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-Sector:\n\n\n\n\nBanking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\nTrust and loan companies\n\n\n\n\n\n\nType of Reservation:\n\n\n\n\nMarket access\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of Government:\n\n\n\n\nProvincial \u2013 Saskatchewan\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMeasures:\n\n\n\n\nTrust and Loan Corporations Act, 1997, S.S. 1997, c.
